The GOP tax plan risks raising millions’ taxes, people’s health care, and even our national security just to give tax breaks to corporate special interests and the wealthiest few. That’s why we must continue to fight it — don’t stop speaking out.

After repeated failed attempts to repeal the Affordable Care Act, the GOP is using this tax plan to sabotage our health care system in a way that would increase health care premiums by an additional 10% a year and mean 13 million fewer people would have health insurance.
Three former Secretaries of Defense from both parties have said that increasing our deficit could mean critical cuts that would make our nation less safe.

This legislation is fiscally irresponsible, dramatically increasing the budget deficit by almost 1.5 trillion dollars. In fact, recent analysis has shown that this plan could risk triggering a $25 billion cut to Medicare.
It eliminates property and local tax deductions, which would mean a tax increase for thousands of Granite Staters.
The latest from the non-partisan Joint Committee on Taxation shows that millions of families earning less than $75K would see a tax increase while the wealthiest few and corporations wouldn’t.
I firmly believe in tax reform that puts hard-working families and small businesses first. Unfortunately, that is not what the GOP tax bill does. Here is why:

This is about basic communication. 128,000 Granite Staters and 83,000 of Granite State businesses rely on these services. And we must ensure that as we upgrade our communications networks, we protect existing service.

Currently, telecom providers must notify customers before making changes to their copper networks, increasing accountability.  But Chairman @AjitPaiFCC wants to change this rule, meaning millions could see a change in their service with no warning and no guarantees.
Tomorrow, the @FCC is voting on the Accelerating Wireline Broadband Deployment by Removing Barriers to Infrastructure Investment order.

Millions rely on traditional copper networks for phone service. The @FCC could vote to weaken rules that protect them. I support efforts to upgrade our telephone networks from copper to fiber, but consumers MUST have notice and assurances that the replacement will be sufficient.

IMPORTANT READ from NH Health Care Assoc. CEO Brendan Williams: #GrahamCassidy is an attack on those on Medicaid:http://bit.ly/2xgmBQG
Bottom-line: The #GrahamCassidy bill is just as dangerous as prior attempts to repeal the ACA & we must stop it in its tracks
10)This bill has been introduced in the midst of bipartisan efforts to strengthen the individual insurance market, putting that work at risk
9) Like prior versions of #Trumpcare, this #GrahamCassidy bill targets women's health and bars state reimbursements to Planned Parenthood
8) It guts the requirement that insurers must cover essential health benefits like substance use disorder, mental health & maternity care
7) It would allow insurers to hike people’s premiums the moment they get sick, even if they've been paying while healthy for years
6) This bill would lead to higher out-of-pocket costs & take away premium assistance from millions of hard-working people
5) #GrahamCassidy also undermines protections for people with pre-existing conditions
4) It cuts over $410 million dollars in federal funding for Medicaid to NH by 2026
3) These massive Medicaid cuts would also lead to funding cuts for school districts and students with disabilities
2) It caps and cuts Medicaid for seniors and people who experience disabilities – putting community-based care programs at risk
1) It ends Medicaid expansion, which experts have called the #1 tool at our disposal to combat the opioid crisis

(2/2) "The vibrant & robust citizen-led democracy that  makes NH the perfect place to host the nation's first presidential primary."
(1/2) "As the spotlight turns toward our state, Americans will also see..."
“I look forward to continuing that important work with all of you. Thank you.”
(4/4) “And come together to make progress for our people, our communities & our economy.”
(3/4) “A place where we overcome our political differences, move past the inevitable arguments…"
(2/4) “As the spotlight turns toward our state, Americans will see a place where we make govt. work for our people & our businesses…”
(1/4) “This week – more than ever – the eyes of our nation are upon NH...”
(6/6) “And I will continue working on these priorities w/  Republicans, Democrats & Independents now & into the future.”
(5/6) “These are the priorities that I have fought for since becoming Governor…”
(4/6) “And maintaining the high quality of life that we are known for in NH…”
(3/6) “Encouraging a thriving economy w/ a strong middle class…”
(2/6) “Working together to address the priorities that are critical to supporting our vibrant communities…"
(1/6) “We have come a long way from the depths of the recession…"
(3/3) “To reducing energy costs & protecting our environment – are fundamental to our shared economic success.”
(2/3) “To workforce development & supporting innovative businesses…”
(1/3) “Each of these individual efforts – from combating the heroin & opioid crisis & reauthorizing the NHHPP…”
“Through @livefreestart we bring together business leaders & entrepreneurs to make it easier for innovative companies to start up & grow.”
“NH was also ranked as the 5th best state for entrepreneurship, and we must continue to build on this progress.”
“Supporting our clean energy sector is critical to protecting the natural beauty that makes NH a special place to live, work & visit.”
(2/2) “To reduce costs for our families & businesses, to create jobs, & to reach a more reliable clean-energy future.”
(1/2) “We must strengthen our energy infrastructure & diversify our energy resources…”
(2/2) “A plan to preserve good roads now in order to avoid more expensive projects later.”
(1/2) “I have put forward a 10 yr. plan that advances critical transportation goals while maintaining fiscal responsibility…”
“The success of our businesses & new start-ups also depends on our efforts to continue strengthening our transportation infrastructure.”
"We must finally restore and increase the minimum wage in New Hampshire."
(2/2) “Through Gateway to Work, we can provide more of the workers our businesses need to thrive.”
(1/2) “Today I am announcing a new plan called Gateway to Work...”
“The successful NH Working program has helped people stay at work, return to work and get ready to work through the recession.”
“As we develop the highly skilled workforce of the future, innovative businesses looking to grow here in NH need more workers now.”
“A strong workforce begins with a strong education at all levels.”
"We must continue working to advance other critical priorities that support economic growth and help innovative businesses create jobs."
“And our small, nimble state govt. must remain responsive to the needs of the business community to support economic development.”
“We need a solid, modern transportation infrastructure & a more affordable energy future in order for our economy to thrive.”
“We need to ensure that our workforce has a deep pool of highly skilled workers to meet the needs of our innovative businesses.”
“Our safe & healthy communities are the foundation of our state, & one of the reasons that NH is a great place to live & to raise a family.”
“We must maintain our commitment to public safety & pass legislation that adequately funds police training.”
“It has never been more important than it is now for NH to continue our strong practice of unified training & community policing.”
"We must continue to be vigilant in our efforts to keep our communities safe & secure.”
(5/5) “And we must re-authorize it now.”
(4/5) “It’s clear that the NH Health Protection Program is making a real difference for our people & boosting our economy…”
(3/5) “The state has also seen an increase in revenues from the insurance premium tax…”
(2/5)  “Hospitals have seen a decline in inpatient, outpatient & ER visits by uninsured Granite Staters…”
(1/5) “Since expansion began..."
“Experts have said that re-authorizing expansion is essential to increasing treatment capacity in NH.”
“Addiction is a disease, & we must ensure that those afflicted w/ addiction can access services to treat this illness.”
(5/5) “Revenues are already more than $40 million above projections this FY…We can afford to address this challenge & we must.”
“Strengthening prevention, treatment & recovery efforts & removing the stigma of addiction are critical parts of a comprehensive approach.”
(4/5) “Combating the scourge of addiction will require additional resources & dollars…”
(3/5) “But we know that this fight is far from over…”
(2/5) “And I commend members of both parties for quickly acting last month to send bipartisan legislation to my desk...”
(1/5) “I applaud the Joint Legislative Task Force on the Heroin & Opioid Epidemic for its hard work…”
“But unfortunately, the heroin & opioid crisis remains the most pressing public health and public safety issue facing our state.”
“Thanks to our remarkable public safety officials, we are one of the safest states in the nation.”
“We know that our people, our families & our businesses cannot grow & thrive without safe communities.”
(2/2) “So that we can build a future where everyone has the opportunity to get ahead & stay ahead.”
(1/2) “It is critical that we equip our people to adapt to this changing economy…”
(2/2) “But our work to keep NH moving forward must never cease.”
(1/2) “We have made real bipartisan progress to set the foundation for a new generation of innovative economic growth…”
(2/2) “Doubling our Rainy Day Fund to its highest level since FY 2009.”
(1/2) “Thanks to a strong economy & careful management of our state budget, we finished FY 2015 w/ a $62 million surplus…”
(3/3) “And following that lead, we continue to prove that we can bridge the political divide & accomplish great things together.”
(2/3) “Setting a strong example for us here in Concord...”
(1/3) “Every single day, Granite Staters roll up their sleeves & work together to solve problems & improve our communities…”
"And thank you to our law enforcement officials, firefighters, & other first responders for all that you do to keep our communities safe.”
“Today & every day we thank all of our services members, vets & their families whose selfless sacrifices make the American Dream possible.”
“Our greatest strength is & always has been the citizens of NH.”
“For the third year in a row, NH was ranked as the strongest state in the Union.”
“Our unemployment rate continues to fall & is now 3.1 percent - the fourth-lowest in the country & the lowest level in nearly 15 years.”
“As our country’s focus turns toward NH & our #FITN primary, Americans will see that the state of our state is strong & getting stronger.”
Gov. Hassan: “I am honored to stand here today to discuss our work together to set the foundation for a new generation of economic growth.”

Governor Hassan Proposes Balanced Budget to Continue Building a More Innovative Economic Future http://www.governor.nh.gov/media/news/2015/pr-2015-02-12-balanced-budget.htm …
“I stand ready to work with any member of either party… so we can continue investing in critical priorities.”
“Over the last two years, we have proven that by working across party lines we can make significant progress.”
“There are additional investments that we may want to make… but the revenue isn’t there to responsibly do those things in this budget.”
“More efficient, more competitive and more successful economically.” (2/2)
“What we have done in this budget is make the strategic investments that we can afford to help make New Hampshire…” (1/2)
“And we must never forget how important it is to the lives of our people.” (2/2)
“The work that state government does must be done efficiently, thoughtfully and frugally…” (1/2)
“These are priorities that must be met…if we want to expand opportunity & build a more innovative economic future.”
“And we know that young people want affordable higher education & modern transportation options.”
“We know that our families are counting on safe communities, good schools & a high quality of life.”
“We know that the business community needs a skilled and healthy workforce, a solid transportation infrastructure & lower energy costs.”
“Allowing the department to fill positions & staff the new women’s prison.” (2/2)
“That is why this budget recognizes our responsibility to adequately fund the DOC…” (1/2)
“But to truly address the public safety needs of our state, we must also renew our focus on the corrections system.”
“But improving public safety must always be an ongoing effort.” (2/2)
“We should be proud that our state has long been recognized as one of the safest states in the nation…” (1/2)
“This budget uses those funds to expand efficiency and renewable energy projects.” (2/2)
“The RGGI and the REF are critical to encouraging energy efficiency & diversification through our growing clean energy sector.” (1/2)
“That is why this budget will allow DRED to develop a workforce recruitment strategy.” (3/3)
“But we also need to once again encourage more young people from other states to choose NH…” (2/3)
“We need to keep more of our young people here in NH…” (1/3)
“Our capital budget includes 4 million dollars for environmental & engineering assessment that this vital project requires to move forward.”
“Commuter rail will build on our many advantages and help set the stage for a new generation of economic growth.”
“We know that a modern, safe transportation infrastructure is critical to the success of our people and businesses.”
“This budget triples funding over the biennium to the Governor's Commission on Alcohol and Drug Abuse Prevention, Treatment, and Recovery.”
“Substance misuse also remains a serious public health and safety challenge facing our state."
“It will allow us to open 25 additional beds at the State Veterans Home.”
“Receive the full care & support that they deserve.” (2/2
“We must also continue our work to ensure that our veterans & their families, who have sacrificed bravely in defense of our freedoms…” (1/2)
“We must maintain our commitment to our bipartisan health care expansion plan.”
“This budget provides for the reauthorization of our expansion plan & includes the funds needed to cover NH’s share in the next biennium.”
“And states without it will see higher costs & find it harder to compete.” (2/2)
“Across the nation, more & more states are moving forward with health care expansion…” (1/2)
“In addition to a highly skilled workforce, we know that our businesses need a healthy workforce in order to grow and thrive.”
“The community colleges have indicated that with this increase, they will be able to lower in-state tuition again in 2016 & 2017.”
“And by 6.5 million dollars at our community colleges compared to Fiscal Year 2015.” (3/3)
“Increasing funding over the biennium by 13 million dollars at the university system…” (2/3)
“This budget builds on the important steps we’ve taken to begin holding down the cost of higher education…” (1/3)
“What I hear more than anything else from our businesses is the need for an even stronger workforce pipeline.”
“In order to improve efficiency & services for our citizens.” (2/2)
“Our budget recognizes the need to begin modernizing the structure of state government…” (1/2)
“This budget implements some of the recommendations of the Innovation Commission… creating the position of a Chief Operating Officer.”
“In my budget, I have been specific and transparent in what I have chosen to fund. The legislature should do the same.”
“While this budget is frugal, it keeps us moving forward.” (2/2)
“We must be frugal – that is who we are as Granite Staters – but we should not be penny-wise and pound-foolish…” (1/2)
“And that we too must adapt our approach to meet those needs.” (2/2)
“But we can still overcome our challenges, together, if we recognize that the needs of families and businesses are changing…” (1/2)
“I hope that we can continue to build on our bipartisan progress of the last two years.” (2/2)
“As we take the responsible actions needed to close out this budget in balance & look toward the future…” (1/2)
“Thanks to prudent management, combined with proposed legislation, we are in a position to finish Fiscal Year 2015 in the black.”
“This is a tight budget that reflects difficult choices.”
“But there are warning signs ahead: our population is aging and in-migration is slowing.” (2/2)
“Today, we stand at a critical juncture. We lead the nation in many measures, and our economic potential is strong…” (1/2)
“While also recognizing that we cannot afford to further erode the revenue sources that we have.” (2/2)
“And it is a budget that does not include a major new revenue source…” (1/2)
“It is a budget that is honest about how we will use our limited resources.”
“It is a budget that continues re-thinking and re-shaping how state government works to make us more effective and efficient.”
“Today, I present to you a fiscally responsible, balanced budget - with no income or sales tax.”

“I look forward to that challenge, and to the brighter economic future that we will all build, and share in, together.”
“…finding the solutions that nobody has thought of, the NH solutions that will help build a more prosperous future for all our people.”(2/2)
“What it will take, throughout our work together, is moving past the inevitable arguments, identifying our challenges and then…” (1/2)
“But as we embark on this next chapter, we must not be deterred, & we must not allow politics to stand in the way of our progress.” (2/2)
“Let us be clear; the challenges before us are great.” (1/2)
“Granite Staters are frugal and we pride ourselves on our small, nimble state government.”
“Each of the challenges that we must overcome to reach our full economic potential can be taken on while living within our means…”
“Our path forward must strengthen wages for our workers by restoring and increasing New Hampshire's minimum wage.”
“But we must innovate, negotiate, and get to solutions that lead to a stronger, more affordable energy future.”  (2/2)
“We will not capitulate to plans that aren’t right for New Hampshire.” (1/2)
“Working w/ local communities, we must find solutions while protecting our beautiful places, natural resources & character of our state.”
“In order for all our people & businesses to succeed, we must achieve the affordable energy future that has eluded our state for too long.”
“That our responsibility to our people, to our businesses, and to our economy cannot sunset.”  (2/2)
“As we plan for the future of health care in our state, we must do so with the commitment” (1/2)
“We must recognize that the benefits of our expansion plan are a critical component of our economic future.”
“…more than 30,000 Granite Staters [have received] coverage through our bipartisan health care expansion plan.”
“All Granite Staters must know they will always have the personal & financial security that comes w/ access to affordable health insurance.”
“Our business community understands the many benefits of commuter rail, and that is why they are calling on us to act.”
“…to spark economic growth for decades to come, we should bring commuter rail from Boston to Nashua and Manchester.”
“We are not going to move our state’s economy forward over the next decade by withdrawing into ourselves.”
“We must make sure that tuition at our universities is affordable enough to help attract & retain young people.” (2/2)
“In our next budget, we must work as hard as we can to continue to hold down the cost of higher education.” (1/2)
“Time to bring our standards into the 21st century to ensure that our students are prepared to compete for jobs in today’s global economy.”
“There is perhaps no area where the needs of our businesses and families intersect more than in education.”
“That’s why we will continue to balance our budget without a sales or an income tax.”  (2/2)
“Our low-tax environment will continue to be important to our economic success.” (1/2)
“We must not let ourselves believe that if we simply do things the same way we’ve always done them, the future will take care of itself.”
“With a relentless focus on ensuring that every Granite Stater who works hard can find success.” (2/2)
“To widen the doors of middle class opportunity, we must approach these next 2 years…” (1/2)
“Whether they’ll be able to make their mortgage payment at the end of the month.” (2/2)
“Our families are focused on whether they can afford to send their kids to college, and…” (1/2)
“We remain at the beginning of our work to ensure that all of our citizens are included in our shared success & prosperity.”
“Though the challenges before us are significant, we are capable of finding that new way forward, because that’s what Granite Staters do.”
“We must always be looking to find that place where differing ideas meet.” (2/2)
“To continue building an innovation economy for our future, with more opportunity for all of our people…” (1/2)
“And over the past two years, we have not allowed the partisan divide to be an obstacle to getting things done.” (2/2)
“The people of our state work through problems together every day, and they expect their elected leaders to do the same thing.” (1/2)
“It is an honor to serve as Gov & I will continue striving… to live up to your trust & to make progress for all of the people of NH.”

"Because, for the State of New Hampshire, the best way forward is always through." #NHSOTS
"We must continue to prove the strength of our democracy by working through our challenges together." #NHSOTS
"I like to say that, in NH, we do democracy better than anyplace else." #NHSOTS
"But what matters – to our economy, to our businesses, to the people of our state – is what we do after we argue." #NHSOTS
"I ask the legislature to heed Becky’s call and pass this bill, pass “Joshua’s Law,” in memory of her beautiful son." #NHSOTS
"establishing a crime of domestic violence... will help law enforcement and prosecutors better identify and stop repeat abusers." #NHSOTS
"...with information about individuals who should not be sold a firearm due to serious mental illness." #NHSOTS
"One pressing public safety issue is the fact that NH does not provide the current background check system..." #NHSOTS
"But we know that our work is never complete, that we can always make our communities safer and stronger." #NHSOTS
"And maintaining NH’s distinction as one of the safest states in the nation is our most important responsibility." #NHSOTS
"...and our sentences to consider alternative options that will focus on treatment first." #NHSOTS
"...on their first offense. That is why I would support a comprehensive review of our criminal code..." #NHSOTS
"I do not believe that a young person with a substance problem should end up in jail, prison or with a criminal record..." #NHSOTS
"We do need to thoughtfully consider our current policies toward substance abuse to refocus on treatment." #NHSOTS
"We must focus on improving access to treatment for all substances, especially among our young people." #NHSOTS
"For those w/ mental health needs & for all patients, providers need to offer the right care, at the right time, in the right place."#NHSOTS
"...to effectively treat those with mental illness, just as they treat others with chronic conditions." #NHSOTS
"We need to work toward a system where all providers have the training, capacity and expertise..." #NHSOTS
"...and we need our communities, our hospitals and our health care providers to remain full partners in this effort." #NHSOTS
"But we must also work to fully integrate these community-based services into our larger health care system..." #NHSOTS
"I encourage the full legislature to... reinforce our commitment to a revitalized community-based mental health system." #NHSOTS
"...and the solutions must be pursued at the community level." #NHSOTS
"This is a challenge facing our health care providers, police officers, and communities across the state..." #NHSOTS
"...and they must be able to access that care before they reach the point of crisis." #NHSOTS
"People with mental illness are our friends, our family members, our neighbors who are simply in need of appropriate care..." #NHSOTS
“…Now let’s get this done.” #NHSOTS
"I thank members of both parties, from both the House and the Senate, for their steadfast commitment to reaching a compromise..." #NHSOTS
"It’s clear that we can work through this together & help working people access critical health coverage." #NHSOTS
"Moving forward with health care expansion is supported by hospitals, providers, businesses, and the people of NH." #NHSOTS
"Right now, we have an opportunity to work through another long-standing issue – healthcare costs and access." #NHSOTS
"...and we can do it w/o sacrificing the scenic views and beautiful natural resources that drive our economy and define us..." #NHSOTS
"By working together, we can take steps to build a stronger, more affordable energy future..." #NHSOTS
"Expanding natural gas pipeline capacity for our region is one way to reduce energy costs in NH." #NHSOTS
"Businesses, families and seniors also need reliable – and affordable – energy to continue to grow and prosper." #NHSOTS
"A modern economy’s infrastructure must also include broadband, especially if our rural communities are to compete." #NHSOTS
"I appreciate that there is broad agreement in the legislature about the need to strengthen investment in our roads and bridges." #NHSOTS
"We know that a solid, modern transportation infrastructure is the foundation for long-term economic growth." #NHSOTS
"...a pressing challenge that has been neglected for far too long: our aging transportation infrastructure." #NHSOTS
"Keeping NH’s economy moving forward will also require us to work through..." #NHSOTS
"I ask the legislature to strengthen our economy and our middle class by passing the Paycheck Fairness Act." #NHSOTS
"We must also renew our commitment to a fundamental principle: an equal day’s work deserves an equal day’s pay." #NHSOTS
"We must restore and increase New Hampshire’s minimum wage." #NHSOTS
"...are confident in their own financial circumstances and able to purchase more goods and services." #NHSOTS
"Truly accelerating our economic growth will only be possible when working families and individuals..." #NHSOTS
"...bipartisan recommendations, recognize that we can do this in a way that works for NH, & vote in favor of authorizing a casino." #NHSOTS
"…invest in critical priorities... I encourage all legislators to fully consider the Authority’s carefully developed..." #NHSOTS
"Developing NH's own plan for one high-end destination casino will create jobs, boost our economy, and generate revenue..." #NHSOTS
"...a new Gold Standard program that will ease regulatory hurdles and highlight businesses with exemplary track records." #NHSOTS
"…To support these companies, I have directed state agencies to explore the creation of..." #NHSOTS
"We also should recognize the contributions of our most upstanding corporate citizens..." #NHSOTS
"I will soon be issuing an Executive Order directing state agencies to move all possible business-related forms online." #NHSOTS
"We also must continue efforts to strengthen fiscal responsibility by innovating in the way state government provides services." #NHSOTS
"And so this year, we will hold a finance summit to help introduce lending organizations and financing partners to businesses." #NHSOTS
"To expand and hire, our small businesses need access to capital investment and support from financial partners." #NHSOTS
"We must... reform workers compensation so that our businesses can re-invest... in growing their companies & creating new jobs." #NHSOTS
"We need to continue supporting common-sense measures that will help our businesses compete and thrive." #NHSOTS
"Through November, our business exports rose 22% in 2013, making NH the fastest-growing state in the nation for exports." #NHSOTS
"Job-creating businesses need to know that NH’s small, accessible & nimble government will continue to be responsive to their needs."#NHSOTS
"...directly with classes at local schools, building relationships that can lead to a stronger workforce pipeline." #NHSOTS
"I have asked Commissioner Jeff Rose and DRED to lead a new effort this year to partner manufacturing companies..." #NHSOTS
"...made up of diverse stakeholders who will make recommendations for modernizing STEM education in our schools." #NHSOTS
"...our educators believe in, & our students & families believe in. That is why I will be creating a STEM Education Task Force..." #NHSOTS
"Our schools need to provide an even more rigorous STEM education that our businesses believe in..." #NHSOTS
"...college- and career-readiness standards effectively, through collaboration with parents, students and educators." #NHSOTS
"For our students to succeed, we must work together to ensure that communities are able to implement..." #NHSOTS
"We have heard from our businesses that we still have work to do to ensure that we have a workforce that can compete in the future." #NHSOTS
"...and made it possible for our universities and community colleges to freeze in-state tuition." #NHSOTS
"We took an important step in that effort working together through the budget. We restored higher education funding..." #NHSOTS
"To build an even stronger workforce, we must keep more of our young people here in NH." #NHSOTS
"We can work our way through to compromise, and through compromise to progress for our economy and our people." #NHSOTS
"We must keep our state and our economy moving forward, and for NH, the best way forward is always through." #NHSOTS
"We face long-standing challenges – from education to infrastructure to energy to health care.” #NHSOTS
"NH remains one of the safest, healthiest and most livable states in the nation – and the best place to raise a family." #NHSOTS
"With nearly unanimous support from those in this historic chamber, we enacted the most bipartisan budget in more than a decade." #NHSOTS
"We have demonstrated that the traditions of hard work, collaboration, and bipartisan problem-solving have returned to Concord." #NHSOTS
"In NH, we have worked together to support middle class families, to help innovative businesses thrive and to grow our economy." #NHSOTS

Governor Hassan Proposes Balanced Budget to Build an Innovative Economic Future http://governor.nh.gov/media/news/2013/pr-2013-02-14-balanced-budget.htm … #nhpolitics
"We must lead the way and work together to build a stronger, more innovative New Hampshire."
"We cannot just assume that the good jobs of the innovation economy will simply appear if we do not act."
"Let me be clear, we must end this process with a balanced budget, and I will veto anything else."
"I stand ready to work with any member of either party who is willing to bring constructive, long-term ideas to the table."
"There are no more one-time fixes. We must develop strategies for a long-term solution."
(2/2) "..while helping our existing businesses grow, transport their goods, and create new jobs."
"Creating a solid, modern infrastructure will attract new businesses and industries.." (1/2)
(2/2) "..one of our most difficult long-standing challenges: New Hampshire’s deteriorating roads and bridges."
"And to truly seize the promise that innovation presents, we must come together and take on.." (1/2)
(2/2) "..and 1,000 long-term jobs, while attracting new businesses and economic development."
"A high-end casino would also bring a significant economic boost, creating more than an estimated 2,000 jobs during construction.." (1/2)
"The social costs many are worried about are already here."
(2/2) "..my budget includes $80 million from licensing one high-end, highly regulated casino."
"That’s why to fund our most pressing priorities, especially higher education and mental health.." (1/2)
(2/2) "..which will still keep our cigarette tax below those of our surrounding states."
"My budget proposes reversing the cigarette tax cut and increasing the tax by an additional 20 cents.." (1/2)
"Cutting the cigarette tax in the last budget has put added strain on our state and put the health of our young people at risk."
"I will soon be issuing an executive order to create a Commission on Government Innovation, Efficiency and Accountability."
"We must always be looking for new ways to innovate in state government in order to cut red tape and save taxpayer dollars."
"This budget moves forward with efforts to make state government more innovative and efficient."
"We must always preserve what has made New Hampshire such a special place to live, work & raise a family: our beautiful natural resources."
"To ensure justice and to improve our public safety, this capital budget includes the funds necessary to build a new women’s prison."
"For too long, our corrections system has woefully neglected women."
"Ensuring public safety also means adequately recognizing that search-and-rescue is an integral state responsibility."
"To improve the safety of our people, this budget puts 15 more troopers on the road."
"People in our most rural areas should not have to wait more than an hour for the nearest state trooper to arrive."
"This budget begins to restore funding for the Children in Need of Services program."
"Like our health care system, our public safety infrastructure took too many hits in the last two years."
"Though we won’t fix all of our challenges at once, it is time to resume our efforts to repair our mental health system."
"This budget helps us move forward with implementing the state’s 10-year mental health plan."
"We must address one of our most pressing public health challenges: the need to restore our mental health system."
"This budget attempts to fully – and honestly – fund our state Veterans Home. And it adds an additional Veterans Services Officer.."
"We must also honor our responsibilities to care for and serve those who have bravely sacrificed for us: our veterans."
"This budget fully funds the waitlists for services for people with acquired brain disorders and developmental disabilities."
"We need to reexamine the massive tax increase imposed by the last budget on New Hampshire’s hospitals."
"Our budget includes Medicaid expansion; it is the right thing to do for our economy, for our state’s finances and for our families."
"By moving forward with Medicaid expansion, we can reduce that uncompensated care and save the avg. NH household an estimated $145 per year"
"Too many of our citizens are unable to access basic, preventive care, forcing them to wait for an emergency before seeking help."
"Let’s help our businesses ... enter new markets. Let’s make NH a leader in selling our services and goods around the world."
"This budget doubles funding for our Research & Development tax credit to help businesses invest in new technologies"
"We need to lay the groundwork and provide the support that innovative businesses need to create those jobs."
"This budget repeals the voucher tax credit that would have diverted millions of $ in taxpayer money to private and religious schools."
(2/2) "..and to allow existing charter schools to accept new enrollees."
"This budget will help encourage innovation by providing funding to allow new charter schools to open.." (1/2)
"This budget protects our state’s commitment to our public K-12 education system by fully funding the existing Adequacy formula."
"Our budget substantially restores the cuts made to our community college and university systems."
"We need to make it possible for our middle-class families to compete and share in the American dream."
"We must ensure that our workforce is the strongest in the nation by making higher education more affordable and more accessible."
"The budget I present to you today puts New Hampshire back on the path to a strong and innovative economic future."
"We have been able to balance the budget while making critical investments in public safety,higher ed.,economic development,& health care."
"We must still make difficult choices to protect our priorities while living within our means."
(2/2) "..economic growth, and creating good jobs to support a strong middle class."
"Today I present to you a balanced budget - with no income or sales tax - that is fiscally responsible and focused on innovation..." (1/2)
"We cannot sit back and wait for the innovation economy to develop. We must lead the way."
The Governor beginning her budget addresspic.twitter.com/ki74cAAG
Gov. Hassan: "We are as well positioned as any state to lead the country in innovative economic growth."

Read the full text of Governor Hassan's Inaugural Address here: http://www.governor.nh.gov/media/news/2013/pr-2013-01-03-inauguration.htm … & Like her official facebook pg:
https://www.facebook.com/GovernorHassan
"With “gladness of heart,” let’s choose to remember what a gift it is to be citizens of the Granite State."
"In this time and in this place, let’s choose to move our state forward with the optimism and pragmatism that is our hallmark."
"Scripture refers to something called, “gladness of heart,” an appreciation of the opportunity and freedom to do difficult things."
"Addressing our challenges will not be easy.  But we are Granite Staters and Americans and we are supposed to do hard things."
"Every time we bring more people in from the margins – into the heart and soul of our democracy – we get stronger."
"Passing Marriage Equality in New Hampshire signaled to everyone the kind of welcoming state that we are."
"Inclusiveness is part of our history."
"But that ethos requires that we fully include all people of talent and energy in the life of our State."
"But what I love most about New Hampshire is the all-hands-on-deck ethos of our people. "
"There is so much that I love about our state... New Hampshire is a place of unmatched natural beauty."
"As lawmakers, we must also recognize that our first and most important obligation is to protect the safety of New Hampshire families."
"If we work together we can fund our priorities and balance the budget."
"While we are seeing signs of recovery and growth, we still face fiscal uncertainty; we will need to be prudent as we develop our budget."
"Among the most challenging tasks ahead is the need to foster innovative economic growth while continuing to balance the state budget."
"I urge members of both parties to share your ideas and concerns with me. My door will be open."
"To address our challenges and seize the opportunity of innovation, we must summon our best traditions of cooperation and problem solving."
"We must recognize businesses cannot innovate and grow without the modern roads, bridges, broadband and reliable & clean power they require"
"To support these businesses, we must recognize that there are some tasks that can only be accomplished in partnership with government."
"We want entrepreneurs with innovative ideas to come to NH, and we want those who start businesses here to stay here and grow here."
"To encourage innovation, we should also encourage the creation of new tech here in NH by doubling the research & development tax credit."
"Businesses are ready and willing to hire... our task is to make sure New Hampshire’s workforce is ready to fill these jobs."
"I want the same for all of NH’s young people as I want for my own children: the opportunity to learn, to grow, and to lead."
"Cutting state support for public education in half while lowering the tobacco tax... was short sighted... We must begin to reverse course."
"But adapting to the demands of an innovation economy presents immediate challenges, too."
"We are uniquely suited to seize the promise and opportunity that innovation presents."
"To our very core, we value freedom, independence, hard work, fiscal responsibility, family and community." - Governor Hassan
"I know that, together, we can build a stronger, more innovative New Hampshire" - Governor Hassan
"No one has exemplified NH's traditions more than the person I am succeeding... thank you, Governor John Lynch."
The Governor has now begun her Inaugural Address: "Thank you for the trust you have placed in me." #NHGOV #NHPolitics
Governor Hassan has now sworn in the members of the Executive Council #nhgov #nhpolitics
